description: {"blocks":[{"key":"481kv","text":"This protocol describes the method for injection of α-Synuclin PFF and monomer into the mouse brain. status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"908t7","text":"Anesthetize the mouse with isoflurane by placing in the anesthesia chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7iejo","text":"Place the anesthetized mouse in the stereotaxic frame and continually maintain isoflurane anesthesia using a vaporizer (Harvard Apparatus).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4l5r2","text":"Locate the injection sites relative to bregma and make holes into the skull using a drill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"262j0","text":"Lower the injection pipette into the brain at the predetermined coordinates. Perform the injection at a rate of 20 nL/s using a Nanoject III microinjector (Drummond Scientific).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"auar7","text":"Following the injection, leave the pipette in place for 10 minutes to prevent backflow while withdrawing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3stl4","text":"Seal the incisions with sutures and allow the mice to recover on a heating pad until conscious. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"en9tq","text":"Continue to monitor the mice and administer the post-operative analgesia. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Protocol for acute slice preparation and electrophysiology
Protocol for acute slice preparation and electrophysiology
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cio30","text":"Transcardially perfuse the anesthetized mouse with oxygenated (95% O2/5% CO2) ice-cold choline artificial cerebrospinal fluid (Choline ACSF) containing (in mM):  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":68,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":75,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fds2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7t82","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"36h41","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["150",100],"data":[["choline","110 "],["NaHCO3","25"],["NaH2PO4","1.25"],["KCl","2.5"],["MgCl2","7"],["CaCl2","0.5"],["glucose","20"],["sodium ascorbate","11.6"],["sodium pyruvate","3.1"]],"guid":"BC7BE94CEE844A16B48BC77C1A069A88","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["choline","110 "],["NaHCO3","25"],["NaH2PO4","1.25"],["KCl","2.5"],["MgCl2","7"],["CaCl2","0.5"],["glucose","20"],["sodium ascorbate","11.6"],["sodium pyruvate","3.1"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Protocol for acute slice preparation and electrophysiology
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"co7uv","text":"Decapitated the mouse and quickly remove the brain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Protocol for acute slice preparation and electrophysiology
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"39fdo","text":"Mount the brain in the vibratome and cut 300 μm thick slices in the coronal plane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Protocol for acute slice preparation and electrophysiology

steps.section: Protocol for acute slice preparation and electrophysiology
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3kjcd","text":"Transfer the slices to the slice chamber that is perfused with oxygenated ACSF.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Protocol for acute slice preparation and electrophysiology
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"if97","text":"Identify layer 2/3 pyramidal cells in the primary somatosensory cortex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
